title: Contrib breaks rendering with gym
body_html:
Using; pyenv, python 3.5.2, tensorflow 0.12, gym 0.7.3, ubuntu 14.04.5 lts, pyglet 1.2.4.

(1) Runs perfectly fine. I see a little game of pong...

import tensorflow as tf
import gym
env = gym.make("Pong-v0")
env.reset()
for _ in range(1000):
    env.render()
    env.step(env.action_space.sample()) # take a random action

(2) Raises: ImportError from pyglet.gl due to 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'decode' in pyglet/compat.py.

import tensorflow as tf
import tensorflow.contrib.slim as slim
import gym
env = gym.make("Pong-v0")
env.reset()
for _ in range(1000):
    env.render()
    env.step(env.action_space.sample()) # take a random action

I doubt the problem is tf.slim. But one of the contrib modules seems to break pyglet.gl.

body:
Using; pyenv, python 3.5.2, tensorflow 0.12, gym 0.7.3, ubuntu 14.04.5 lts, pyglet 1.2.4.

(1) Runs perfectly fine. I see a little game of pong...
```
import tensorflow as tf
import gym
env = gym.make("Pong-v0")
env.reset()
for _ in range(1000):
    env.render()
    env.step(env.action_space.sample()) # take a random action
``` 

***
(2) _Raises_: `ImportError` from pyglet.gl due to `'NoneType' object has no attribute 'decode'` in pyglet/compat.py.
```
import tensorflow as tf
import tensorflow.contrib.slim as slim
import gym
env = gym.make("Pong-v0")
env.reset()
for _ in range(1000):
    env.render()
    env.step(env.action_space.sample()) # take a random action
``` 

I doubt the problem is tf.slim. But one of the contrib modules seems to break `pyglet.gl`.
